titleStmt.title: Tamiḻneṟi Viḷakkam 19.
Experimenting with formatting for the final edition.

div.p: [The heroine] thinking of the path by which [the hero comes] comes and saying , "Do not come!"; the desolate speech [of the heroine] on account of her imprisonment; [the heroine] saying, "[You] ought to come."; [the heroine] saying, "Do not come!"; [the confidante] speaking fabrications; [the confidant] speaking of the excellence of [the hero's] family; [the confidante] saying, "Now, I know [the heroine]" - they say that [these] and others which are suitably expressed, taken together, are [the situaions of] asking for marriage.

body.head: Commentary
body.p: The quoted [cūttiram] intends to make known the way in which 'asking for marriage' occurs.

āṟu pārttuṟṟa vaccak kiḷaviyum varavu vilakkaluṅ kāppiṉ iraṅkiya kaiyaṟu kiḷaviyum iraviṉum pakaliṉum nī vā veṉṟalum vāral eṉṟalum paṭaittu moḻitaluṅ kuṭit tiṟaṅ kūṟalumāṉiṭa makaḷ ātal iṉṟaṟintēṉ eṉṟalum eṉa viṉṉa vellām varaivu kaṭātal eṉṟu colluvar pulavar eṉṟa vāṟu.

div.p: [The heroine's] speech about [her] fear when thinking about [the hero's] path.
[The heroine's] speech about [her] overwhelming sadnes, weeping because [she is under] guard.
eṉpatu iraviṉum pakaliṉum nī vā veṉṟatu.
[The confidante] says, "You come, either by day or night."
[The confidante] says, "Do not come, either by day or night."
[The confidante] talks about the issue of [her] family.

standOff.note: Cf. TP164i.1:...kaiyaru kiḷavi
Cf. IA30.2: kāppuc ciṟaimikka kaiyaṟu kiḷaviyum
Cf. TP207i.5: kiḻavōṉ ṟaṉṉai vāra lenṟalum |
Cf. IA30.5: kiḻavōṉ taṉṉai vāral enṟalum |
Cf. IA12.8: paṭaittumoḻi kiḷaviyum

The sitaution for which the TP employs this phrase is slightly different, but as this is the only time in the TP where this phrase is used, so I think it is reasonable to expect that this would have been known to the author of this text. In the TP it refers to the desolation of an intermediary arguing for the hero to be allowed home after an affair.
Cf. IA30.3: āṟupārt tuṟṟa accak kiḷaviyum
Cf. TP207i.4: iraviṉum pakaliṉu nīvā veṉṟaluṅ |
Cf. IA30.4: iraviṉum pakaliṉu nīvāru veṉṟalum |
Cf. IAC30, p.149: talaimakaṉai iraviṉkaṇṇum pakaliṉkaṇṇum vāral eṉṟu collutal
Cf. IAC30, p.147: aḵtāmāṟu, talaimakaṉ iravukkuṟivantu oḻukāniṉṟa nilaimaikkaṇ, emporumāṉ varumvaḻi iṟappavum iṉṉātu, nīruṭaittu kalluṭaittu muḷḷuṭaittu ēṟṟuṭaittu iḻivuṭaittu eṉak kavaṟal;
Cf. PK228 also for the equivalent poem in the IAC spoken by the heroine. PK 220-228 all treat this topic, but the others are spoken by the confidante.
Cf. KT88.2: ciṟukaṭ peruṅkaḷiṟu vayappuli tākkit
Cf. PK220-227 also. These poems all treat this topic, though none in quite the same way as the TNVC verse. They are left unquoted due to space concerns, and becuase none are an obvious direct source.
Cf. IAC30, p.145: ciṟaikāval eṉpatu, tāytuñcāmai

Cf. PK215 (IAC30, p.145): āyun tamiḻmaṉṉaṉ ceṅkōl varōtayaṉ vañciyaṉāḷ | tēyum niṉaivoṭu tuñcāḷ maṭantaiyic cēyiḻaiyāḷ | tāyum tuyilmaṟan tāḷiṉṉa nāḷtaṉait tāḷneṭuntērk | kāyum takirōṉ malaipōy maṟainta kaṉaiyiruḷē||

Cf. PK229 (IAC30, p.148): uravum kaṭalcūḻ ulakuṭai vēntaṉ ucitaṉoṉṉār | paravum kaḻalmaṉṉaṉ kaṉṉiyaṅ kāṉaṟ pakaliṭamnī | varavu makiḻntilaḷ taiyalvey yāṉpōy malaimaṟainta | iravum varaveṉṉa ūṉama tāmniṉ tiṉṉaruṭkē||

Cf. AN118.5-10 (IAC30, p.149): iyalmuru koppiṉai vayanāy piṟpaṭap | pakalvariṟ keḷavai añcucutum ikalkoḷa | irumpiṭi kaṉṟoṭu viraiik kayavāyp | peruṅkai yāṉai kōṭpiḻait tarīi | aṭumpuli vaḻaṅkum āṟiruḷ naṭunāḷ | taṉiyai varutal ataṉiṉum añcutum |

Cf. PK236 (IAC30, p.151): aṉṉāy nernal nikaḻntatu kēḷayal vēṅtiṟaiñcum | poṉṉār kaḻalneṭu māṟaṉ kumariyam pūmpoḻilvāy | miṉṉār maṇineṭun tērkaṅkul vantoṉṟu mīṇṭatuṇṭāl | eṉṉā mukañcivan temmaiyum nōkkiṉaḷ emmaṉaiyē||

Cf. PK237 (IAC30, p.151): paṇivar collikaṇ ṭāḷteṉṉaṉ pāḻip pakaitaṇitta | maṇivar cīrmaṉṉaṉ vāḷneṭu māṟaṉ malayameṉṉum | ciṇivar kuṉṟat taruviceṉ ṟāṭiyor vēṅkaiyiṉkīḻk | kaṇivar kātaṟ piṭiyoṭu niṉṟa karuṅkaḷiṟē||
